"As far as theservice goes he is quite punctil- ious, your excellency; but his character . . ."said Timokhin. 
"And what about his character?" asked the regimental commander. ^ 
"It's different on different days," answered the captain. "One day he is sensible, well edu- cated, and good-natured, and the next he's a wild beast In Poland, if you please, he near- ly killed a Jew."
